H0.text: Clots occur in arteries that can cause heart attacks and strokes.

H1.text: Toxins occur in arteries that can cause heart attacks and strokes.

H2.text: Tumors occur in arteries that can cause heart attacks and strokes.

H3.text: Lesions occur in arteries that can cause heart attacks and strokes.

A4.text: A thrombus (blood clot) usually forms around atherosclerotic plaques.

A5.text: Arterial thrombosis follows rupture of atheroma (a fat-rich deposit in the blood vessel wall).

A6.text: Embolisms, depending on their specific location, can cause more significant effects like strokes, heart attacks, or even death.

A7.text: Arterial thrombosis resulting from hypertension or atherosclerosis can become mobile and the resulting emboli can occlude any artery or arteriole downstream of the thrombus formation.
